item.description:
Summertime - and our pencils are lazy
Would rather bask than type a story or two
But don't fear - we've got something to help you
So come out, now dear writers
This is just for you...

George and Ira Gershwin wrote the famous opera Porgy and Bess, which was first performed in 1935 and most famously known for "Summertime." While we're not expecting you to write any famous operas while at the Blue Shirt, we do hope that the summer air will at least stir up a good line or two.

And if you're in the mood for singing (or at least some beverages), we'll be heading over to Charlie's Kitchen in Harvard Square for some karaoke afterward.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for a group with writing implements!
